CORPORATE TRAINING

 

 

 

 

 

 

Submit Training Request Form
Explore Potential Training Topics

Villanova's College of Professional Studies partners with employers and organizations to deliver customized strategic training programs, workforce education and professional development solutions. Whether on-site, online, on-campus or in a hybrid format, Villanova offers a tailored education plan that helps organizations meet their strategic goals and objectives, and fills the gaps in employee training and skills.

Explore our portfolio of programs and courses designed for an evolving workforce and corporate trends. Courses can be selected from our existing portfolio or created from scratch in areas where we have faculty expertise.

Our team can become a valuable training partner and provide an exceptionally supportive and collaborative educational experience that ultimately contributes to your organization’s growth and success!  

   

Customized Training


We will deliver a strategic, effective, and tailored professional education plan, with support from start to finish.

Flexible Options


We will collaborate to build the course or program in a format that works for your organization, whether on-site, online, on Villanova's campus, or as a hybrid.

Competitive Pricing


We are committed to providing affordable, flexible pricing options that suit the overall learning and development objectives of your organization.

Distinguished Faculty


We will provide one of Villanova's esteemed faculty members who is experienced in the field and committed to providing a successful learning experience for your employees in support of your organizational goals.


 

POTENTIAL TRAINING TOPICS

Project Management
    -Introductory Course
    -CAPM Exam Prep
    -PMP® Exam Prep

New Manager Bootcamp

Lean Six Sigma
    -White Belt (mini-course)
    -Yellow Belt
    -Green Belt
    -Black Belt

Problem Solving & Prevention

Time Management: Macro to Micro

Agile

Human Resources
   -Introductory Course
   -SHRM CP/SCP Exam Prep

Leadership

Sales Foundations

Business Writing

Business Process Improvement Essentials

Contract Management

TRAINING PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT PROCESS

From conception to completion, CPS will work closely with your stakeholders to design and implement a learning program that meets your organization’s overall objectives and goals.  We trust this collaborative and creative approach will result in a successful and impactful partnership.

Step 1: EXPLORE
CPS will collaborate with your organization’s leaders to thoroughly identify learning objectives for any individual units, work groups, or leadership teams you choose.
Connect with us today!

Step 2: BUILD
Partnering with our distinct faculty, CPS will work to craft a program or course, including content, tools, and resources, while offering the most effective delivery method for your program – on-site, on campus, online or a hybrid option.

Step 3: IMPLEMENT
We will provide your organization with a comprehensive and tailored learning program that affords participants the opportunity to immerse themselves in the full Villanova learning experience. 

Step 4: EVALUATE
At the conclusion of your program, CPS will continue to partner with your organization to assess learning and provide thoughtful guidance for future learning opportunities.

MEET OUR FACULTY

KAREN GRAZIANO

Karen Graziano J.D., M.A., is a leadership, writing, and communications professor, trainer, consultant, and coach. She specializes in teaching professionals how to maximize their own and their team’s potential by helping them understand strengths and motivation so they can develop a vision and action plan.

MARV MEISSNER

Marv Meissner is a Quality and Training Executive with 25+ years’ experience in leadership roles within both manufacturing and transactional and administrative environments,. Marv possesses a strong management background and his specialties include:  Lean Six Sigma, Total Quality, Continuous Improvement, Change Management, Training, Training Within Industry (TWI), Kepner-Tregoe Analytic Troubleshooting.

In a recent Philly Mag article, Marv said “Change has never been happening as fast as it is now. A lot of companies are familiar with the types of subject matters taught, but they’ve not had structured training and education on those topics.”

RALPH GIGLIOTTI

Ralph A. Gigliotti, Ph.D. is Director of Leadership Development and Research in the Center for Organizational Leadership at Rutgers University, where he also teaches in the Department of Communication and Ph.D. Program in Higher Education. Ralph’s research and consulting interests explore the intersection of organizational communication, leadership, crisis communication, and training and development within the context of higher education.

PARTNERSHIPS


 


 

CONNECT WITH VILLANOVA
800 E. Lancaster Ave
Villanova, PA 19085
CONTACT US
610-519-4500
